comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Presumably www.catholic-hierarchy.org/bishop/bfarley.html and en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Murphy_Farley Judging from the picture in the Wikipedia article, he is the smallest of the four men. The welcome is after a trip to Europe, From NYT of Sept 29, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D01E2D81638E633A... "Cardinal Farley returned from Europe last night on the steamer Sant' Anna of the Fabre Line, which left Naples on Sept. 13."

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
St. Patrick's (New York) welcomes the return (from Europe) of Cardinal Farley:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/6130630058/in/photostream/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/6130078349/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The Cardinal was returning from Rome, where he had gone to participate in the Papal Conclave held to elect the new Pope. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papal_conclave,_1914.
